topic: How to profile stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to profile stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+
response_raw:
{
  "title": "Profiling Stream Processing with FastAPI in Python 3.12+",
  "summary": "This guide showcases how to use profiling tools in Python 3.12+ to optimize the performance of stream processing applications built with FastAPI.",
  "key_points": [
    "Understand the importance of profiling for efficient stream processing.",
    "Install necessary packages: `uvicorn`, `fastapi-metrics`, and `cProfile` or `line_profiler`.",
    "Create a FastAPI application with a stream processing endpoint using AsyncStreamingResponse.",
    "Profile the stream processing function using cProfile or line_profiler decorators.",
    "Monitor and analyze the profiling results in real-time through FastAPI Metrics.",
    "Optimize the stream processing function based on the profiling insights."
  ],
  "code_examples": [
    {
      "language": "python",
      "code": "```\n\
import fastapi\nfrom fastapi.responses import AsyncStreamingResponse\n\
from fastapi_metrics import Timer, metrics\n\
from io import BytesIO\n\
import cProfile\n\
\napp = fastapi.FastAPI()\n\
timer = Timer(name='stream_processing')\n\n@app.get('/stream', response_class=AsyncStreamingResponse)\nasync def stream():\n    timer.start()\n    # Your stream processing function here\n    timer.stop()\n    return BytesIO(timer.data, 'utf-8')\n\n# Run with cProfile decorator for profiling\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    pr = cProfile.run('app.stream()', sort='cumulative')\n    for line in pr:\n        print(line)\n```"
    }
  ],
  "version_notes": [
    "Python version: 3.12+",
    "FastAPI version: ^0.74.0",
    "fastapi-metrics version: ^0.16.1",
    "uvicorn version: ^0.17.6"
  ],
  "caveats": [
    "Remember to install the required packages using pip.",
    "The given example is simplified and may need adjustments based on your specific use case.",
    "Profiling can significantly slow down the execution of your application, so be cautious when running in production."
  ]
}
